content:
Diagnosis:		Gastric neuroendocrine carcinoma

Staging:		T4N3M0 (Stage IIIC)

Histology:		Poorly differentiated neuroendocrine carcinoma
		Synaptophysin positive, Chromogranin positive
		Ki67 80%

Management:		12 Jan 2024 - Total gastrectomy
		D2 lymphadenectomy - 8/15 nodes positive

Current Status:	Post-operative recovery

MDT Discussion:	Case presented at Upper GI MDT 15 March 2024

The MDT reviewed post-operative imaging showing no evidence of residual or metastatic disease. Given the high-risk features (T4 disease, nodal involvement, Ki67 80%), the consensus recommendation is for adjuvant platinum-etoposide chemotherapy. The proposed regimen is 6 cycles of carboplatin AUC 5 and etoposide 100mg/m2. Patient to be reviewed in medical oncology clinic next week for chemotherapy discussion. Routine surveillance imaging to be arranged at 3-monthly intervals.

Plan:		Medical oncology review 22 March 2024
		Baseline CT chest/abdomen/pelvis prior to chemotherapy
		Routine chromogranin A monitoring
